data.title: Lion and the King
data.meta_description: Lion and the King (also known as King of the Animals 2, The Lion and his Son and Son of the Lion King, originally known as Der König der Tiere: das grosse Abenteuer) is a Dingo Pictures movie that was released in 1999. It's a sequel to King of the Animals and a mockbuster of The Lion King II...
data.text:
Lion and the King (also known as King of the Animals 2, The Lion and his Son and Son of the Lion King, originally known as Der König der Tiere: das grosse Abenteuer) is a Dingo Pictures movie that was released in 1999. It's a sequel to King of the Animals and a mockbuster of The Lion King II: Simba's Pride.

Summary

It's business as usual in the jungle. The old lion had been a good-natured and wise king and the animals usually obeyed his orders. Only Robin, the king's little son didn't want to obey him all the time. His dream was to find the treasure of the black Panther, who had been chased away by the animals. The old lion tried to keep his son from the treasure search especially since this treasure had brought only misfortune. But Robin did not worry about it. At the same time Pino, the son of the black Panther planned to get the treasure. Both of them met. Now this new story of the animal king tells how the two enemies finally became friends.

Cast

See also: Lion and the King/Credits

Armin Drogat

Thorsten Morawietz

Pascale Drogat

Simone Greiss

Trivia

General

Interestingly, the stereo mix of "10. Mai" is used in this movie. Usually, only the audio from the left channel would be used.

This was the first ever Dingo Pictures movie that was reviewed by Phelous.

A few lines (e.g. "The diamonds! My god!" and "Your father, the black panther, is your father?") became memes ever since he reviewed the movie.

Despite being a sequel, this film changes many elements from its predecessor:

While the previous King of the Animals took place in what appears to be a tropical jungle, this movie has a more savannah-like setting.

Robin's mother is nowhere to be found, something that is never brought up.

While the Panther is implied to be the same antagonist from the first film, he's never refered to by his original name Bokassa.

The rabbit character that Robin befriended in the first film doesn't appear at all. Dundee can be considered as a replacement since they fill a similar role.

Goofs

English dub

Robin's line "Your father, the black panther, is your father?" is read in a way that makes it sound redundant. The first "your father" was likely supposed to be said as a separate questioning statement.

Dundee's voice actor's chair is heard creaking when he tells Robin about wanting the bird to clean his teeth.

Some English plot summaries refer to the Panther's son as Pino, however the character in the dub is actually named Mew-Mew
